Resume: We propose a new framework for estimating generative models via an adversar- ial process, in which we simultaneously train two models: a generative model G that captures the data distribution, and a discriminative model D that estimates the probability that a sample came from the training data rather than G. The train- ing procedure for G is to maximize the probability of D making a mistake. This framework corresponds to a minimax two-player game. In the space of arbitrary functions G and D, a unique solution exists, with G recovering the training data distribution and D equal to - everywhere. In the case where G and D are defined by multilayer perceptrons, the entire system can be trained with backpropagation. There is no need for any Markov chains or unrolled approximate inference net- works during either training or generation of samples. Experiments demonstrate the potential of the framework through qualitative and quantitative evaluation of the generated samples.
ResumeSynthetique: Cet article propose un nouveau cadre pour l'estimation de modèles génératifs à travers un processus adversarial, en formant simultanément un modèle génératif et un modèle discriminatif. Le modèle génératif cherche à tromper le modèle discriminatif, qui tente de distinguer les données réelles des données générées. Le système utilise des perceptrons multicouches et peut être entraîné par rétropropagation sans nécessiter de chaînes de Markov ou d'inférence approximative.
